infotexts.entitydescription.mannitolplus: An improved version of mannitol. It is used to quickly treat neurotrauma.
infotexts.entitydescription.artificialbrain: An artificial brain transplant that keeps a body alive when the original brain is removed.
infotexts.entitydescription.surgeonclothes: A sterile surgical scrub for the prevention of infection during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.surgicalmask: A mask that keeps airborne pathogens away from your patient during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.brainjar: A container to hold brain transplants indefinitely
infotexts.entitydescription.surgicaldrapes: Sterile sheets to prevent infection during surgery.
Sterile sheets to prevent infection during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.skillbooksurgery: A handbook containing numerous surgical procedures and steps to reproduce them.
infotexts.entitydescription.triagetag: A label that is used to efficiently determine the type and urgency of care required for a patient in the case of a mass casualty event.
infotexts.entitydescription.manualtriagetag: A manual triage tag. Apply to the legs for green, arms for yellow, torso for red and head for black.
infotexts.entitydescription.experimentaltreatment: A highly experimental drug that can cause either a little or a lot of good or bad.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.artificialbrain: The patient is permanently unconscious, but the body remains alive.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.triagetag_green: The patient has been gived the "minor" triage tag. They don't require treatment.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.triagetag_yellow: The patient has been gived the "delayed" triage tag. Their injuries are not life-threatening.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.triagetag_red: The patient has been gived the "immediate" triage tag. They require immediate treatment.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.triagetag_black: The patient has been gived the "deceased" triage tag. Medical attention is better spent elsewhere. They are as good as gone.
infotexts.jobdescription.surgeon: While the medical doctor is better suited for first aid and quick response, the surgeon specializes in the optimization of surgical procedures. Lower risk of infection, faster execution, if it's related to surgery, the surgeon has it.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_autoimmune: Organs that you transplant never get rejected.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_properfol: [itemname] that you administer instantly takes effect.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_soothingsurgeon: People you operate on suffer less traumatic shock
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_preventativepermi: The last person you ordered gains [physicalresistance]% damage resistance and is less likely to suffer serious injuries.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_medicallicence: Organs you extract sell for full price.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_bedsidemanner: Patients next to you passively heal at an accelerated rate. The effect is doubled if they are laying in bed.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_rinseandrepeat: Drainages, endovascular balloons and needles no longer get consumed when you use them.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_underpressure: Unconscious patients next to you gain [amount]% bloodloss, organ damage and neurotrauma resistance.
infotexts.talentdescription.ntsp_rapiddeoployment: Gain additional movement speed equal to [skillpercentage]% of your surgery skill.
